intro: Ocotea ovandensis, commonly known as the Ovandén cinnamom tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like cinnamon and avocado. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its bark and leaves contain essential oils, contributing to its use in traditional medicine and as a source of aromatic compounds. The tree is also valued for its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
